memberDescription: [u'I have tried to travel as much as possible since I was a teenager. Money has often been an issue, but I\'ve learned that travel doesn\'t have to require going a great distance, as there is a lot to discover in California itself. But when I have had the chances to go abroad, I have experienced several different circumstances: I\'ve traveled with young children and then teens and fellow adults (as my kids have grown). I\'ve traveled solo and as part of a couple as well. For me, travel means taking the time to explore and discover, not just seeing the "required" sites. I love to walk through cities as much as possible so that I I see the places (small "p") as well as the Places. There are times when I have splurged, but times when I have been on a very tight budget. (Traveling with a family of 5, you almost have to splurge just for budget accommodations!) "Blending with the locals" is an ideal I\'d like to achieve because "wanting the comforts of home" doesn\'t suit me. ']
review:
I would recommend this activity for California visitors and residents alike. The "accomplice" ploy itself starts out corny, and it's awkward when the group is trying to get started, get "into it," etc., but it really builds and becomes quite a bit of fun. memberDescription: [u"Love to travel and will go where time and money afford. And if there's a bargain, and I haven't been there, I go. Work for myself, husband is retired, kids out of house makes this easier. Would rather be gone longer and stay 2 to 3 star. Wish I could afford to fly business or first. At this point, for accommodations, only need clean, well-located, and private bath (unless shared is only choice someplace I want to go). Usually love B&B's. Old anthro major, so cultures that are in danger of changing are of most interest. Usually do extensive research on internet (used to go to libraries, if anyone can remember back that far).Normally put together individual travel itinerary. Will take tour if feel more comfortable or language insurmountable, e.g. Antarctica, Africa, Russia. Or if led by someone special (e.g. restauranteur Tommy Tang who took a small group to Thailand.) Will drive if navigable and husband willing, e.g. Czech Republic, Ireland, Italy. Will cruise if it's a bargain and ports are interesting. "]

All of Kapowui's instructors live within blocks of the beach and surf every day. This is a life choice for us. We are not a corporate machine grinding out massive quantities of sub-par internet coupon lessons with minium wage non surfing employees. Kapowui is a locally owned business with soul that only hires real surfers. At Kapowui we truly care about your experince. So in the short time we have together we imerese you in the surf culture. Giving you the opportunity to feel the true surfer vibe, and gain a skill you can use forever. That is why many of the 4 and 5 star hotels in Los Angeles call us to service their guest (i.e. Four Seasons, Ritz Carlton, Beverly Hills Hotel, Shutters, Loews, Viceroy, Chateau Marmont, etc.) Whether surfing is a 1-time bucket list item or a new sport you want to pick up, we will have you up and riding waves your 1st lesson or your next lesson is free. At Kapowui, you are not just another number or dollar sign to us. You are family. So, come hang out with your brothers and sisters, and let's go catch some WAVES!!! Even if you don't do a lesson, come by and say "HI".Your lesson will take place at one of 4 iconic California beaches, Venice, Marina Del Rey, Malibu, or Santa Monica, where the sandy bottoms are safe and perfect for beginner lessons. Your lesson includes surfboard, wetsuit, and instructor. We ofer 1 hr., 1 1/2 hr., and 2 hr. lessons. The first 20 minutes of each lesson is done on the beach, covering board design and dynamics, wave dynamics, beach safety, surfing safety, surf etiquette, pop-up technique and form. The remainder of your time is spent in the water, surfing with your instructor. Everything is included, you only need to bring a positive vibe, however people often like to bring sunscreen, towel, and water.
review:
Fantastic teachers! Saw Kapowui's orange van in the parking lot at Santa Monica beach and didn't know if they'd be great teachers for my kids (daughter, 15 & son, 12). Martin...

name: LadyMarMar
CitiesVisited: Los Angeles, CA, USA,Dubrovnik, Croatia,Santa Teresa, Costa Rica,Albuquerque, NM, USA,Amsterdam, The Netherlands,Antwerp, Belgium,Aspen, CO, USA,Athens, Greece,Bangkok, Thailand,Barcelona, Spain,Beijing, China,Bodrum City, Turkey,
Type: Bathroom facilities, Activities for young children, Activities for older children
ownerdesc: At kapowui, we live, eat, and dream surfing. We teach surfing because we want to share our love and stoke for the sport. All of our instructors are imbued with the Aloha spirit. Kapowui believes we are all part of one big family, so when we are doing a lesson, we are 100% focused and in the moment with you. All of Kapowui's instructors live within blocks of the beach and surf every day. This is a life choice for us. We are not a corporate machine grinding out massive quantities of sub-par internet coupon lessons with minium wage non surfing employees. Kapowui is a locally owned business with soul that only hires real surfers. At Kapowui we truly care about your experince. So in the short time we have together we imerese you in the surf culture. Giving you the opportunity to feel the true surfer vibe, and gain a skill you can use forever. That is why many of the 4 and 5 star hotels in Los Angeles call us to service their guest (i.e. Four Seasons, Ritz Carlton, Beverly Hills Hotel, Shutters, Loews, Viceroy, Chateau Marmont, etc.) Whether surfing is a 1-time bucket list item or a new sport you want to pick up, we will have you up and riding waves your 1st lesson or your next lesson is free. At Kapowui, you are not just another number or dollar sign to us. You are family. So, come hang out with your brothers and sisters, and let's go catch some WAVES!!! Even if you don't do a lesson, come by and say "HI".Your lesson will take place at one of 4 iconic California beaches, Venice, Marina Del Rey, Malibu, or Santa Monica, where the sandy bottoms are safe and perfect for beginner lessons. Your lesson includes surfboard, wetsuit, and instructor. We ofer 1 hr., 1 1/2 hr., and 2 hr. lessons. The first 20 minutes of each lesson is done on the beach, covering board design and dynamics, wave dynamics, beach safety, surfing safety, surf etiquette, pop-up technique and form. The remainder of your time is spent in the water, surfing with your instructor. Everything is included, you only need to bring a positive vibe, however people often like to bring sunscreen, towel, and water.
review:
Bucket list...check!
I finally went surfing for the first time in my life, and I couldn't be happier that I did it with Kapowui. I didn't wanna go alone, so I asked a girlfriend to go with me. Neither of us had ever surfed before. We met with Martin on the most amazingly beautiful day. It was already winter, but...

name: Kay64
CitiesVisited: San Francisco, CA, USA,Los Angeles, CA, USA,Akumal, Mexico,Chamonix, France,Island of Hawaii, HI, USA,Kilimanjaro National Park, Tanzania,Oahu, HI, USA,Paris, France,Yellowstone National Park, WY, USA,Cusco, Peru,Honolulu, HI, USA,Niagara Falls, Ontario, Canada,
Type: Bathroom facilities, Activities for young children, Activities for older children
ownerdesc: At kapowui, we live, eat, and dream surfing. We teach surfing because we want to share our love and stoke for the sport. All of our instructors are imbued with the Aloha spirit. Kapowui believes we are all part of one big family, so when we are doing a lesson, we are 100% focused and in the moment with you. All of Kapowui's instructors live within blocks of the beach and surf every day. This is a life choice for us. We are not a corporate machine grinding out massive quantities of sub-par internet coupon lessons with minium wage non surfing employees. Kapowui is a locally owned business with soul that only hires real surfers. At Kapowui we truly care about your experince. So in the short time we have together we imerese you in the surf culture. Giving you the opportunity to feel the true surfer vibe, and gain a skill you can use forever. That is why many of the 4 and 5 star hotels in Los Angeles call us to service their guest (i.e. Four Seasons, Ritz Carlton, Beverly Hills Hotel, Shutters, Loews, Viceroy, Chateau Marmont, etc.) Whether surfing is a 1-time bucket list item or a new sport you want to pick up, we will have you up and riding waves your 1st lesson or your next lesson is free. At Kapowui, you are not just another number or dollar sign to us. You are family. So, come hang out with your brothers and sisters, and let's go catch some WAVES!!! Even if you don't do a lesson, come by and say "HI".Your lesson will take place at one of 4 iconic California beaches, Venice, Marina Del Rey, Malibu, or Santa Monica, where the sandy bottoms are safe and perfect for beginner lessons. Your lesson includes surfboard, wetsuit, and instructor. We ofer 1 hr., 1 1/2 hr., and 2 hr. lessons. The first 20 minutes of each lesson is done on the beach, covering board design and dynamics, wave dynamics, beach safety, surfing safety, surf etiquette, pop-up technique and form. The remainder of your time is spent in the water, surfing with your instructor. Everything is included, you only need to bring a positive vibe, however people often like to bring sunscreen, towel, and water.
review: My 13 y.o. son did a private surfing lesson and he loved it. The price was reasonable, it was easy to book with them. He had Luke as an instructor and did really well, was able to catch a lot of waves. My son even got a shark tooth necklace at the end as a souvenir.

Activitiy: Whiskey Blue at the W Hotel, Los Angeles
ownerdesc: Located on the lobby level of the W Los Angeles, Whiskey Blue is the destination for the Los Angeles it crowd and a haven for VIPs who want to shy away from the limelight for a night. World-renowned interior design team Yabu Pushelberg created a breezy Polynesian hideaway through their dynamic design, provocative lighting accents and statement art pieces by Moss & Lamb. An immaculate staircase leads to an expansive lounge area where guests can enjoy seasonal cocktails from Whiskey Blues ever-changing selection of libations. A small bites menu is available, provided by Executive Chef Dakota Weiss of Bravos Top Chef. Whiskey Blue also features a private event space, outdoor patio and an adjacent caf.

memberDescription: [u'I was born and raised in St. Petersburg, Florida. My husband is bilingual so that allows us to travel to areas where English is not fluent. We are Happy Hour Hunters. Our primary choice on accomodations it to rent with kitchen abilities so we can visit local farm produce and cook local. To us; nothing better than local produce or fresh fish on a grill. We are both early retired; enjoy experiences like zip-lining, horseback riding, surfing, hiking, etc. We are adventurous in learning new cultures and love to discover new places to explore. We take great pleasure in packing up a cooler and just taking in a "field trip". We love meeting people; making friends wherever we go and try to blend into the communities of which we are visiting. When visiting within the US; we always look up a Diner, Drive-In or Dive from the Food Network show and finding out of the way places to visit. Our motto is: "As long as we live on this Earth; we want to travel it". ']

Activitiy: The Bazaar by Jose Andres, Los Angeles
Type: Deemed "Four Stars" from the Los Angeles Time, finalist for the James Beard Awards' "Best New Restaurant," named Esquire Magazine's "Restaurant of the Year" and Zagat's "Top Newcomer," The Bazaar by Jose Andres is a vibrant mix of sophisticated cuisine and playful lounge spaces where dining transcends into fete extraordinaire. Experience a collection of magical dining experiences, entwined in a modern-day, European-inspired "indoor piazza" -- savor pioneering culinary creations, delicacies from roving carts and delicious libations by James Beard Award-Winning Chef Jose Andres. **From October to November join Jose Andres in celebration of the opulence of white truffle season with the third annual White Truffle Dinner Series at SAAM . The multi-course dinner unearths the flavors of the truffle through the playful imagination and inventive gastronomic vision.
review: I really liked both the food and the decor of the restaurant. Both were hip and refreshing. Everything we ate from the extensive menu was delightful, and our drinks were really fantastic too. I'll be back the next time I am in LA.

memberDescription:
[u'With friends and family living throughout California from north to south, west to east, I enjoy traveling throughout the state frequently.
I also enjoy domestic and international travel.
I enjoy road trips, train trips, car trips, and cruises.
While I enjoy nice resorts, if we plan to see the sights from sun up to sun down, moderate and,safe lodging works just fine.
Fine dining, wineries, and restaurants with a view are quite nice
but picnics in a state or national park, a day at the beach, or family style restaurants are just fine.
We love a range of outdoor activities and we love to explore cities too.
Night life does beckon. When on the road our favorite night life places to go is Los Angeles area or to go to Nevada either Reno or Las Vegas.
In short, travel is amazing. ']

memberDescription:
[u'With friends and family living throughout California from north to south, west to east, I enjoy traveling throughout the state frequently.
I also enjoy domestic and international travel.
I enjoy road trips, train trips, car trips, and cruises.
While I enjoy nice resorts, if we plan to see the sights from sun up to sun down, moderate and,safe lodging works just fine.
Fine dining, wineries, and restaurants with a view are quite nice
but picnics in a state or national park, a day at the beach, or family style restaurants are just fine.
We love a range of outdoor activities and we love to explore cities too.
Night life does beckon. When on the road our favorite night life places to go is Los Angeles area or to go to Nevada either Reno or Las Vegas.
In short, travel is amazing. ']

Activitiy: Battleship USS Iowa BB-61, Los Angeles
ownerdesc: Visit the West Coast's only Battleship! Celebrate the American Spirit by stepping through time on the 70 year-old teak decks of Battleship IOWA. Your tour will take you through the spaces used by President Franklin D. Roosevelt, numerous 5-Star Admirals, Top Ranking Naval Officers and thousands of Enlisted Sailors. You'll love getting up close to the giant 16" Guns, feeling 18" of cold solid steel in the Captain's Bridge, seeing the evolution of weaponry from WWII through the Cold War, hearing first-hand stories from Navy veterans, and experiencing life as a Sailor on the "Big Stick". Your family will be awed by IOWA's proud, historic legacy as one of the fastest and most powerful ships to ever set sail!
review:
We all learn history, but nothing compares to "seeing & touching" it. Take a tour with one of the many volunteers for a fascinating look back at the incredible engineering on this ship before the computers of today. You can do a self-guided walk, but a personal tour offers so much more information and a chance to ask questions --great...

Activitiy: Battleship USS Iowa BB-61, Los Angeles
ownerdesc: Visit the West Coast's only Battleship! Celebrate the American Spirit by stepping through time on the 70 year-old teak decks of Battleship IOWA. Your tour will take you through the spaces used by President Franklin D. Roosevelt, numerous 5-Star Admirals, Top Ranking Naval Officers and thousands of Enlisted Sailors. You'll love getting up close to the giant 16" Guns, feeling 18" of cold solid steel in the Captain's Bridge, seeing the evolution of weaponry from WWII through the Cold War, hearing first-hand stories from Navy veterans, and experiencing life as a Sailor on the "Big Stick". Your family will be awed by IOWA's proud, historic legacy as one of the fastest and most powerful ships to ever set sail!
review: Big Ship with big history! complete with the armor and system. Knowledgeable guides, though there is also a self-guided tour which you can take. highly recommended.

Activitiy: Magic and Wine Tasting with David Minkin, Los Angeles
review: This deserves to be the most popular attraction because David combines all the elements of a great time--friendly people, great wine, delicious food, and best of all an amazing magic show that makes a believer of even the most cynical skeptic. This was right up there with my trip to Sequoia and King's Canyon National Parks. Thank you, David

ownerdesc: The Grand Salon showcases cars of the 1910s to 1930s. There are also collections of furniture, dolls, timepieces and one of the world's finest collections of mechanical musical instruments.
review: A fabulous collection of vintage cars from 1910s to 1930s. This is not just about cars, this museum has also the finest collection of mechanical musical instrument which is one of the best in the world. And the best thing about visiting this place is that its FREE!

ownerdesc: The Grand Salon showcases cars of the 1910s to 1930s. There are also collections of furniture, dolls, timepieces and one of the world's finest collections of mechanical musical instruments.
review: This is a real find in the north valley. A fabulous collection of classic cars, some displayed in a setting meant to resemble a car dealership from the 20s or 30s. There's also an old railroad car beautifully adorned and fit for a robber baron before TR started busting up the trusts. Definitely worth a visit.
